titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Vassar College Realia Collection, circa 1648-2020 (bulk 1818-2000)
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Emma Gronbeck, June 2025.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: The collection consists of physical culture materials and objects related to Matthew Vassar, his family, and Vassar College, as well as miscellaneous items of historical note.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of physical culture materials and objects related to Matthew Vassar, his family, and Vassar College, as well as miscellaneous items of historical note.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into three series: Series I. Vassar Family; Series II. Vassariana; and Series III. Miscellaneous and Historical Objects.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library .

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Vassar College Realia Collection, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

scopecontent.p: This series includes objects owned by or affiliated with Matthew Vassar and members of his family.

arrangement.p: Organized into subseries by family member and sub-arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.p: This series includes objects used by, related to, or depicting Vassar College, as well as alumnae/i, faculty, presidents, trustees, and administrators of Vassar College, including artifacts, memorabilia, and souvenirs.

arrangement.p: Organized into subseries by object type, sub-arranged alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Series III. Miscellaneous and Historical Objects,

scopecontent.p: This series includes various historic objects not directly connected to Vassar College.

p.emph: Unidentified piece. Rod-shaped pendant of some kind. Open on one end--possibly broken; set with a yellow stone on the other. Potentially part of the piece in section 5?
Unidentified piece, gold. A coil wound around a branch with an empty ring hanging off of it. Appears to be a brooch or pin of some kind, but the piece is not designed to pierce fabric.
Unidentified piece. Possibly a necklace. Broken chain with ring-like pendant and stopper-like pendant attached. Both pendants are set with red stones.
Gold oval cuff link, engraved with "C.V."
Single earring, gold, pierced
2 keys, found in Catherine Vassar's sewing case, do not belong to case
Dark wood box with floral inlay on lid, containing a number of silver sewing tools.
Lavender-pink, silk print with branching pattern that looks like Christmas lights.
Black ribbon belt with floral embroidery (circa 1820) which belonged to Lydia Booth.
Brown and tan plaid taffeta basque (boned, jacket style) with bolero length, wide sleeves.
Ecru, lace. Lydia Booth referred to as "Spanish Lace."
Brown waist apron with floral embroidery worn by Matthew Vassar Jr.'s mother, Margaret (Van Kleeck) Vassar.
Pink gingham apron worn by Matthew Vassar Jr.'s mother, Margaret (Van Kleeck) Vassar.
Silver, initials "MB" Maria Vassar Booth
Black, fringed edge. Belonged to Maria Vassar Booth
Ecru / white, cotton, ruffled edge with floral embroidery.
Small wooden barrel container. Ends are painted orange.
Leather billfold.
Leather card case.
Wooden cylinder-like container with intricate leaf and vine patterns and rounded ends. Screws together in two pieces. Cracked on one half through the threads.
White/cream teacup with a Gold ring painted around the upper edge. Matching saucer.
Container in the shape of a ceramic nut with top and bottom parts.
White china plate with blue and gold edging.
Three white china teacup saucers with blue and gold edging.
White china teacup with blue and gold edging.
Carved wooden cigar case. Belonged to Matthew Vassar.
Rusted chain-link collar. Inscribed plaque reads "Don Vassar."

p.emph: door lock and handle, wood and metal.
Various envelopes, found in the drawer of Matthew Vassar's desk.
Wooden pedestal with carving of a woman in formal dress with two long braids sitting on a stump, one arm missing or broken.
Carved, round ivory game in 3 pieces.

White ceramic beer pitcher with gold trim, initialed MV and dated
One umbrella and several canes. One cane "given to Truman J. Backus, received from Rev. G. H. Backus, 1913 Apr 29."
3 metal trunks, 2 with floral designs, 1 printed with "M. Vassar"
Handheld nut cracker, wood, with handle, carved in the shape of a lion.
Gold pocket watch. Belonged to Matthew Vassar. Front glass is loose and metal frame will not close.
Black leather spectacle case, missing cap.
Brass frame with octagonal lenses.
Rusted, silver-colored metal frame with oval lenses. Right lens frame is broken and lens has fallen out.
Silver-colored metal frame with oval lenses.
Silver-colored metal frame with oval lenses. Both lenses cracked.
Brown leather spectacle case containing rusted black-frame spectacles with oval lenses.
[Brass]; figure (no head) next to barrel
Stereoscope, wood and brass, design of Joseph L. Bates, patented 1867. Owned by Matthew Vassar.
Silver, inscribed "MV Jr"

did.unittitle: John Guy Vassar - Watch fob, gold,

p.emph: Large gold locket with portrait of Marquis Georges Le Vasseur, an ancestor of Matthew Vassar, on one side, and an ornate hair knot on the other side. Glass cabochon covering portrait has separated from the locket.

did.unittitle: Mary E. Atkinson - Cross stitch of Vassar Family Record,

p.emph: Delicate cross stitch of the Vassar Family's genealogical record, including James and Ann Vassar, and their 8 children. Mary E. Atkinson (1822-1834) was the daughter of Keziah Vassar (1799-1834) and William B. Atkinson, and Matthew Vassar's niece.
[Watercolor] in ornate gold frame
Crimson, floral embroidery.

Metal straight razor with whalebone(?) handle, manufactured by Clauss Barber Special in Fremont, Ohio. "M. Vassar" is etched into the handle, but the manufacturing dates of the razor mean that it could not have belonged to either Matthew Vassar or Matthew Vassar, Jr.
White fan used at graduation by Mary Crockerhouse (VC 1871)
VC reunion parasol, red paper and bamboo

did.unittitle: Commemorative cup, Frances A. Wood, silver,

p.emph: tall silver cup with lid and handles, inscribed to VC Librarian Frances A. Wood.
Key to Miami-Dade County given to Frances Fergusson, housed in original black box
Philalethean Society cup - silver three-handled. Presented to the Philalethean society for excellence in literary competition.
Ornate silver bowl, gifted to the Class of 1896 from the Class of 1871. Inscribed to: "Grandaughters of Vassar College. Souvenir from '71. 1871 - 1896"
Silver trophy cup with handles from ANCM Intercollegiate Competition Plays. Won by Vassar Miscellany in 1917.
Silver vase, inscribed to Mary R. Sanford (VC 1892) from a classmate

Gold locket with picture of Miss Lyman (1st Lady Principal) and lock of Prof. Wm. Mitchell's hair -- given to Alida C. Avery

Leather locket given by Hannah W. Lyman to Dr. Alida C. Avery (VC physician 1865-1874). Decorated with monograms of Dr. Avery and Miss Lyman. Presented by M.M. Waldron (VC 1872). Once contained a photograph of Miss Lyman, Vassar's first Lady Principal, and a lock of hair from Prof. William Mitchell. (Locket contents location is unknown.)

Probably not from VC, though two appear Henriette A. Neuhaus (VC 1903). 1 - rectangular, gold with black enamel, engraved with "PKA" (Rho Kappa Lamda) on the front and "H. Neuhaus" on the back. 2 - triangular, gold with black enamel, Engraved with "Tau Tau Sigma," what appears to be three overlaid letters ("C" "P" and "I") on the front and "H.A.N. '96" on the back. 3 - Diamond, gold with black enamel and pearls, "Sigma Lamda Nu" on front, "A.D.S. '95" engraved on back.

did.unittitle: SS Vassar Victory pin, with box,

p.emph: A gold pin the shape of a V with a bird of prey in the center. Presented to Elizabeth Gatchell Bouton christening of the SS Vassar Victory ship. did.unittitle: Piece of marble from Main Building addition,

p.emph: Fragment of red and white marble from the lobby of "The Soap Palace," the addition to the front of Main Building built by Frederick F. Thompson and torn down in 1960.

did.unittitle: Place card for supper in James Monroe Taylor's new president's house,

p.emph: Place card with name "Miss [Brae Kennings?]" written on wood and cyanotype of the house pasted on.
Plaster mold of relief sculpture of Elizabeth Dodge (VC 1913) in side profile.
Small (circa 6x9 inch) slate board with writing stick and sponge eraser. Probably belonged to Elma G. Martin, Spec. 1892-1893.
Slide rule owned by Edith Roberts. In leather case with half of original box. Model N4041. Serial number 524908. Date derived from serial number.
Leather card case from the VC Class of 1925
Miniature photo album in leather case, initialed "F. H. H."

did.unittitle: Photograph of portrait of Lucy Maynard Salmon in decorative case,

p.emph: Black and white photograph of a portrait of Lucy Maynard Salmon as a young woman, painted by Alice zur Carr Boscowitz. Mounted in a decorative metal case. Original painting is in the Loeb.

did.unittitle: Shredded posture photos, Physical Education Department,

p.emph: Envelope of "shredded" (almost powdered) posture photographs shredded by the Smithsonian under the supervision of VC historian Betty Daniels.
Five white, ceramic, shield-shaped plaques labeled "OBS" (Observatory), and numbered 1, 3, 6, 11, and 13.
Brass plaque honoring recipients of Borden Freshman Prize.
Brass with wood mount and screws.
Memorial plaque of Herbert E. Mills, metal

Plaque reads: "These lounges were furnished in 1973 by a gift of the James A. Macdonald Foundation in honor of the memory of Edward Handelman for his interest, and that of his family, in Vassar College."
Relief plaque of FDR portrait (VC trustee)
Plaque reads: "This room is a gift from the Cleveland H. Dodge Foundation in Honor of Mary Bliss Dodge, Class of 1913"

Plaque reads: "Three Sisters Carillon - Given in honor of Eleanor Lanctot Van Horn Ex Class of 1930, Sarah Lanctot Rigg, Class of 1936, Katherine Potter Lanctot Class of 1939, Great-Great-Grandnieces of Matthew Vassar A.D. 1955"

did.unittitle: Plaque - YWCA Salute to Women and Girls - Vassar College,

p.emph: Wooden plaque gifted to Vassar College by the YWCA as part of their Salute to Women and Industry program, with brass-colored inlays. Includes spaces for 12 individual name inlays, but only one is filled, for "Natalie Junemann Marshall, 1989."
Plaque reads: "The books in this section are the donation of Carlo Zuccaro. Taormina Sicily in memory of his wife Bertha Bates of Saint Louis, Missouri, Class of 1899."

did.unittitle: VC Avery Hall Plaque - Alida C. Avery,

p.emph: Brass plaque honoring Alida C. Avery, mounted in Avery Hall prior to its renovation into the Vogelstein Center.

did.unittitle: VC Avery Hall Plaque - Gertrude Buck,

p.emph: Brass plaque honoring Gertrude Buck, mounted in Avery Hall prior to its renovation into the Vogelstein Center.

did.unittitle: VC Avery Hall Plaque - Mabel Lockwood,

p.emph: Brass plaque honoring Mabel Lockwood, mounted in Avery Hall prior to its renovation into the Vogelstein Center.

Round, silver chafing dish with stand, burner, 2 pans, and a lid with a Vassar College seal welded to it. Owned by Laura S. West (VC 1914).

Silver sugar tongs with "AH" engraved in the handle. Most likely from the Alumnae House.

did.unittitle: Citation for war service in France,

p.emph: Paper citation thanking Margaret Clark Neal for her service with the AEF.
Notes left by students at each other's dorm room doors.

Wrapper from a piece of gum, printed with text titled "Flirtation - Fan Flirtation No. 1" followed by instructions on how to use a fan to flirt. Features a line that says "Let the Vassar girl lend an ear."
Passport issued by U.S. State Department to Ella Dodge (VC 1876)

p.emph: From the Alumnae/i House?

did.unittitle: Street car schedule for Vassar College,

p.emph: "City Rail Road - Cars Leave Vassar College..." Printed schedule, framed.
VC calendar
3 "joke" scrolls
cardboard box with an illustration of a "Vassar girl" labeled "Vassar Lawn"
Decorative Menu, June 12, 1894
VC notepad "Alumnae House"
VC notepad "Inaugural '86"
Stickers, pink and gray VC pennants
Audograph index strips used by French Department for language instruction.
Audograph vinyl recording disks used by French Department for language instruction.

Graphophone wax cylinder player in wooden carrying case, device inside box is in disrepair. wax cylinders, and Audograph vinyl recording disks (2 boxes) used by French Department for language instruction
three small miniature binoculars, two with images of Main Building, one with the Philadelphia exhibition of 1876

Set of "Hurst's Stereoscopic Studies of Natural History, for Schools and Parlor Entertainments," published circa 1870, housed in beautiful wooden box with engraved plate reading "Vassar College." Appear to all be images of natural history exhibits at the Free Museum in Albany, NY. Included note reads "Thought to have been in Main Parlor."
6 views of the Vassar College Art Gallery (circa 1877?), taken and published by Slee Brothers Photographers in Poughkeepsie. Includes duplicates.

did.unittitle: Stereographs - VC Museum of Natural History,

p.emph: 3 views of the Vassar College Museum of Natural History (circa 1877?), taken and published by Slee Brothers Photographers in Poughkeepsie. Includes duplicates.
Typewriter with wooden base and metal cover secured with 4 latches. Reputed to be the oldest on campus, came from the Chemistry Department
portable Corona typewriter used on her field trips
Handheld metal paper embosser, embosses "Vassar College Library."
Edison gold molded record of the Vassar Girls Quartette
Wax cylinders used by French Department for language instruction
Class of 1913 bag, blue felt with white lettering
pink wool blanket with V's on it
Black velvet academic robe that belonged to Sarah Gibson Blanding. Made by Cotrell & Leonard.
Green apron with black edging, Class of 1911
Black with white velvet and pink ribbon stripes.
Baccalaureate Hood made by Cottrel & Leonard, Albany N.Y. Belonged to Ethel M. Fair (VC 1906)?
Baccalaureate Hood of Elisabeth W. Allen, VC 1904, made by Ede & Ravenscroft.
VC Class of 1910 graduation hood made by E. Moore Company Chicago. Gown missing?
VC Class of 1953 rose and gray bloomers
Class of 1911 bonnet
Christening dress of Cornelia Marjorie D. MacCracken, cream/beige with tassels and shawl.
VC Class Day dress that belonged to Harriet Bradley Fitt, VC 1913
Class Day dress, pink, of Elizabeth (Fish) Wright, VC 1932.
White cotton lace commencement dress and petticoat worn by Eleanor Brinsmade, VC 1907
Commencement dress, pale blue-green satin, worn by Laura (Huntington) Brown, VC 1878. Dress consists of a skirt, top, 2 lace sleeves, and decorative maroon and gray ribbons.
Commencement dress, cream with tassels and beaded collar, of Mary E. Carter, VC 1911
White cotton and lace Daisy Chain dress in two pieces, worn by Edith (Start) Hurd (VC 1908).
VC Daisy Chain dress that belonged to Harriet Bradley Fitt, VC 1913
Graduation cap with peace sign pinned to it
VC mortarboard of Alice Howland, VC 1896

did.unittitle: Clothing - Graduation cap, gown, and hood,

p.emph: VC graduation clothing
Blue cotton one piece "leotard" and separate blue cotton brief skirt, made by Wright and Ditson for 1939 Vassar College Freshman "Body Mechanics" Class. Belonged to Anne (Reed) Dean (VC 1943).
VC gym suit, black (in 2 pieces). One-piece jumpsuit with "'14" in pink felt on the back and matching black skirt.
VC tan gabardine gym suit
Navy blue gym suit pants belonging to Margaret Beard Gilpin (VC 1916)

2 VC gym suits, wool, dark blue with dark green trim. Each outfit consists of a long-sleeve button-up shirt and baggy pants. One pair of pants has the name "M. C. Nelson(?)" on the inside and the other has "M. Stager(?)"
VC reunion hat, straw with maroon hat band, owned by Margarete Midas Meyers, VC 1948/1949
Class of 1911 hat band(?)
White cotton/dungaree buttoned jacket, presumably worn by Laura West, VC 1914 at a 1938 VC reunion
Seven Sisters Tennis Championship, green shirt with long sleeves.
Five masks printed with Vassar logo and scenes issued as precaution against COVID-19.
VC Class of 1935 mittens, red white and blue woolen mittens with 1935 on them
Blue scarf with Cornaro Window design
Scarf showing pendants of Vassar, Radcliffe, Smith, Bryn Mawr and other womens colleges.
silk scarf with images of the Vassar campus
VC 50th reunion scarf, cream, stenciled "96"
Thin blue scarf with white "VC" logo.
Thin red scarf with "VC" logo on one end and outline of Main Building on the other.
Scarf, yellow, printed with Cornaro Window design (Lorenzo Silk Creations)
Yellow and green basketball jersey worn by VC WWII veteran [wool?]
VC Varsity sweater, gray
Heathered gray sweatshirt with red and black Vassar College logo on chest and left sleeve.
Light gray heathered sweatshirt with Vassar seal in pink.
Marathon swimsuit - Vassar(?), used circa 1948-1968.
Pink tie with cornaro window design. Has some stains.
Africana Studies 20th Anniversary t-shirt, red with print of a piece of African art.
Class of 1987 reunion t-shirt, white with maroon print.
Founder's day t-shirt, white with black print on front and back. "20 Coed Years at Vassar - What a Long and Strange Trip It's Been"
Founder's Day, White shirt with print of Matthew Vassar and "More Than a Brewer"
Gray t-shirt with VC centennial seal printed in black
Light gray t-shirt with maroon print of Thompson Library and "So Many Books, So Little Time"
Vassar College Women's Weekend t-shirt, white with black image and text "Act Up!"
Green Co+ed=VC t-shirt
T-shirt, heather gray with maroon print: "1949-1999, Vassar Book Sale, Vassar Club of Washington, D.C., We Turn Used Books into a College Education"
VC Earth Day t-shirt, tan with green print. On back is a quote from Annie Dillard
VC Founder's Day t-shirt
WVKR-fm Poughkeepsie Free Radio, white t-shirt
2 Founder's Day t-shirts, dark blue, on theme of Disney's Fantasia. Image is Matthew Vassar With Disney's Wizard's Hat.
maroon visors with VC '70 in grey letters
Pink ribbons used to tie VC diplomas.

VC handkerchief

White with red embroidery. Belonged to Gail R. Becker (VC 1964).

white and blue pillow top with scenes of VC buildings

rose and grey gros-grain (silk) ribbons used to tie Vassar College diplomas

blue canvas reunion bag

white canvas tote bag with blue handles, image of Ferry house and words "Ferry House 55 years"
White square of fabric with the Vassar seal printed in pink.
"Le Jeu des Academiciens" presented to the President of Vassar College by the French class of 1882 and Professor R. See.
"Le Jeu des Mythologie" dedicated to H.W. Webster by the French class of 1880 and Professor R. See.

Doll with Greiner head, wearing a faded calico dress. Includes a small copy of a book "Food for Christians" and two fabric flowers. Accession record reads: "Doll was dressed to represent 'Miss Vassar 1865' for display by the Worcester College Club in a doll show. She was an old family doll owned by Cynthia Carey of Worcester, MA."
unopened - 2 packs

did.unittitle: Class of 1900, folding sign or table (?),

p.emph: Wooden disk, painted yellow and printed with "1900," has legs and folds so that the disk is flat like a table instead of upright like a sign. one arm appears broken.

did.unittitle: Decoupage box with scene of VC,

p.emph: Round, wooden decoupage box painted with a scene of Vassar College.
wooden blocks placed in a box and pulled for rooms in the dorms. Only a sampling.
wooden bootjack [supposed to have hung from student's doors]
wooden bootjack [supposed to have hung from student's doors]
wooden bootjacks [supposed to have hung from student's doors]
Pink Vassar College seal printed on round mdf fiberboard.
souvenir boxes (2) painted red with Vassar scenes. "Vassar College in 1865"

did.unittitle: Wooden Gavel with metal plaque attached,

p.emph: Wooden gavel with metal plaque reading: "Jeanne Schock Vassar Student Association President 1988-1989"

did.unittitle: Series III. Miscellaneous and Historical Objects,

p.emph: Certificate of admittance(?) to Poughkeepsie Female Collegiate Institute for Charlotte Tallman.
child's small wooden rocking chair
Decorative, handheld folding fans.
Set of memory beads in a box of E. Faber Pocket Pencils.
Commemorates the 100th anniversary of Albany, NY
Paris exposition medal, for exhibition on women in higher education put together by Elizabeth M. Howe collaborating with the Association of Collegiate Alumnae. Includes accompanying letter.
Paris exposition medals (3). Three different medals set in a wooden plaque.
Yale University 200th anniversary medal
Portrait of a young woman by [H. Harding?] in red wooden case.
Portrait of a young woman in red velvet frame.
2 paper dolls with assorted outfits. One doll includes an envelope labeled "Amusements for Little Girls. Lizzie," and is published by McLoughlin Brothers Manufacturers, 24 Beekman St, NY.
Mahogany. Exposed glue on one side--perhaps missing a piece.
"Piece of wood from the window through which Charles I attempted to make his escape." Circa 1648.

did.unittitle: Plaster replica of WWI monument designed by Louis Majorelle,

p.emph: Plaster (?) replica sculpture of Louis Marjorelle's memorial monument to the first three American soldiers killed in the First World War: James Bethel Gresham, Thomas Enright, and Merle Hay.

did.unittitle: Reproduction of the Miracle at Cana,

p.emph: Reproduction by F. Parsons of 11th Century Byzantine Art depicting two scenes from the life of Jesus in the collection of the Victoria and Albert Museum, London.

did.unittitle: Reproduction of a Panel of a Book Cover,

p.emph: Reproduction by F. Parsons of 12th Century Byzantine Art in the collection of the Victoria and Albert Museum, London. Top right corner broken.
Sterling, engraved "Roberta"
Large, round ceramic vase, white with blue glaze and chipped black paint around the top and bottom. Depicts an East-Asian style landscape scene.

did.unittitle: Wooden gavel with metal plaque attached,

p.emph: Wooden gavel with metal plaque reading: "Made of the elm under which in 1775 George Washington assumed command of the Continental Army"
